intro: Taraxacum nudicola, commonly known as the naked-stem dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a single, hollow stem that supports a flowering head. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that develop into white, fluffy seeds with parachute-like structures for wind dispersal. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
